idiom: Die kat is uit die sak
literal_meaning: The cat is out of the bag.
example: Now that everyone knows about the surprise party, die kat is uit die sak.
Don't met die vinger wys at others; take responsibility for your actions.

idiom: Die appel val nie ver van die boom nie
literal_meaning: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
example: He acts just like his father; die appel val nie ver van die boom nie.

literal_meaning: To get something under the knee.
example: After a lot of practice, she finally het dit onder die knie gekry.

figurative_meaning: A situation has reached a critical point.
example: Things have escalated; die pot het gekook.
Stop being so idealistic; jou kop in die wolke won’t help you now.

figurative_meaning: To be overly cautious or measuring everything.
example: He approaches every situation met 'n skaal in die hand.
After graduating, die wêreld is jou oester.
He decided to om 'n leeu te skiet by starting his own business.

literal_meaning: A pig in a Christmas tree.
example: He felt like ’n vark in ’n kersboom at the formal event.
